Posts.Title: CT ordered for swelling above collarbone myra justprayin

Posts.Content: myra wrote: Dear BC Sisters -- Someone please tell me that I shouldn't be freaking out! I'm a 2 year survivor of Stage 1 IDC, treated with lumpectomy,rads and tamoxifen. (Had negative SNB...no lymphatic invasion detected). I just had a routine 6 month follow up with rad onc, and she noticed swelling above my left (ipsilateral) clavical, and ordered a CT scan of the area. When I asked what she was looking for, she implied that I MIGHT have mets in the lymph nodes in this area. (Info on the web indicates that "supraclavicular lymph node mets" could mean you have a Stage IIIc recurrance!!! So now I'm scared witless!) Of course the swelling could be from any number of other causes -- RIGHT? It feels soft and "puffy" like edema or fatty tissue to me... Anyone have this before, and can you tell me something less frightening that it might be?! Myra Kia Orana (Live long!) Dx 1/3/2005, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CT ordered for swelling above collarbone myra justprayin

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2007 02:41AM myra wrote: THANK YOU Chelee! It does seem that we have similar symptoms, and knowing that so many doctors have examined you and are not concerned is very reassuring to me! I also suspect that it may be lymph fluid "pooling" even though I've never had arm lymphadema... I should get an appt for the CT tomorrow, and will let you know the results. Thanks again for replying -- it really helps!
Posts.Title: CT ordered for swelling above collarbone myra justprayin

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2007 10:14PM myra wrote: Thanks Gabrielle...I feel SO much calmer after hearing from others here that their supreclavicular "puffiness" turned out to be no big deal. My CT is scheduled for Wednesday, and in the meantime I have a previously scheduled appt. with my breast surgeon tomorrow...I really trust her & will feel even better if she doesn't seem too concerned. -- Myra
